channel.title: Deploy composite applications on Oracle Fusion Middleware on Kubernetes
channel.description: Recent content in Deploy composite applications on Oracle Fusion Middleware on Kubernetes

item.title: Deploy using JDeveloper
item.description: Learn how to deploy Oracle SOA Suite and Oracle Service Bus composite applications from Oracle JDeveloper (running outside the Kubernetes network) to an Oracle SOA Suite instance in the WebLogic Kubernetes operator environment. Use JDeveloper for development and test environments only. For a production environment, you should deploy using Application Control and WLST methods. Deploy Oracle SOA Suite and Oracle Service Bus composite applications to Oracle SOA Suite from JDeveloper To deploy Oracle SOA Suite and Oracle Service Bus composite applications from Oracle JDeveloper, the Administration Server must be configured to expose a T3 channel.

item.title: Deploy using Maven and Ant
item.description: Learn how to deploy Oracle SOA Suite and Oracle Service Bus composite applications using the Maven and Ant based approach in an Oracle SOA Suite in WebLogic Kubernetes operator environment. Before deploying composite applications, we need to create a Kubernetes pod in the same cluster where the Oracle SOA Suite domain is running, so that composite applications can be deployed using the internal Kubernetes Service for the Administration Server URL.
